intro: Pedicularis sceptrum-marianum, commonly known as the Marian's crown. It is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. The plant is characterized by its striking red and yellow flowers that resemble a crown, hence its common name. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and semi-parasitic plants. The species thrives in nutrient-poor soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine environments.
